SPI1CON.name: SRXISEL
SPI1CON.caption: SPI Receive Buffer Full Interrupt Mode bits

values.caption: Interrupt is generated when the buffer is full
Interrupt is generated when the buffer is full by one-half or more
Interrupt is generated when the buffer is not empty
Interrupt is generated when the last word in the receive buffer is read (i.e. buffer is empty)

SPI1CON.name: STXISEL
SPI1CON.caption: SPI Transmit Buffer Empty Interrupt Mode bits

values.caption: Interrupt is generated when the buffer is not full (has one or more empty elements)
Interrupt is generated when the buffer is empty by one-half or more
Interrupt is generated when the buffer is completely empty
Interrupt is generated when the last transfer is shifted out of SPISR and transmit operations are complete
SDI pin is not used by the SPI module (pin is controlled by PORT function)
SDI pin is controlled by the SPI module
Master mode
Slave mode
Idle state for clock is a high level; active state is a low level
Idle state for clock is a low level; active state is a high level
SSx pin used for Slave mode
SSx pin not used for Slave mode
Serial output data changes on transition from active clock state to Idle clock state (see CKP bit)
Serial output data changes on transition from Idle clock state to active clock state (see CKP bit)

SPI1CON.name: SMP
SPI1CON.caption: SPI Data Input Sample Phase bit (master mode only)

values.caption: (Master mode) Input data sampled at end of data output time / (Slave mode) value is ignored
(Master mode) Input data sampled at middle of data output time / (Slave mode) value is ignored
(AUDEN = 1) 24-bit Data, 32-bit FIFO, 32-bit Channel/64-bit Frame / (AUDEN = 0)32-bit
values.name: SETTING1

values.caption: (AUDEN = 1) 32-bit Data, 32-bit FIFO, 32-bit Channel/64-bit Frame / (AUDEN = 0)32-bit
values.name: SETTING2

values.caption: (AUDEN = 1) 16-bit Data, 16-bit FIFO, 32-bit Channel/64-bit Frame / (AUDEN = 0)16-bit
values.name: SETTING3

values.caption: (AUDEN = 1) 16-bit Data, 16-bit FIFO, 16-bit Channel/32-bit Frame / (AUDEN = 0)8-bit
values.name: SETTING4

values.caption: SDOx pin is not used by the module. Pin is controlled by associated PORT register
SDOx pin is controlled by the module
Discontinue operation when CPU enters in Idle mode
Continue operation in Idle mode
SPI/I2S module is enabled
SPI/I2S module is disabled
Enhanced Buffer mode is enabled
Enhanced Buffer mode is disabled

SPI1CON.name: SPIFE
SPI1CON.caption: Frame Sync Pulse Edge Select bit

values.caption: Frame synchronization pulse coincides with the first bit clock
Frame synchronization pulse precedes the first bit clock
REFCLKO1 is used by the Baud Rate Generator
PBCLK2 is used by the Baud Rate Generator

SPI1CON.name: FRMCNT
SPI1CON.caption: Frame Sync Pulse Counter bits. Controls the number of data characters transmitted per pulse. This bit is only valid in Framed mode.

values.caption: Reserved
Reserved
Generate a frame sync pulse on every 32 data characters
Generate a frame sync pulse on every 16 data characters
Generate a frame sync pulse on every 8 data characters
Generate a frame sync pulse on every 4 data characters
Generate a frame sync pulse on every 2 data characters
Generate a frame sync pulse on every data character
Frame sync pulse is one character wide
Frame sync pulse is one clock wide

SPI1CON.name: MSSEN
SPI1CON.caption: Master Mode Slave Select Enable bit

values.caption: Slave select SPI support enabled. The SS pin is automatically driven during transmission in Master mode. Polarity is determined by the FRMPOL bit.
Slave select SPI support is disabled.
Frame pulse is active-high
Frame pulse is active-low

SPI1CON.name: FRMSYNC
SPI1CON.caption: Frame Sync Pulse Direction Control on SSx pin bit

values.caption: Frame sync pulse input (Slave mode)
Frame sync pulse output (Master mode)
Framed SPI support is enabled (SSx pin used as FSYNC input/output)
Framed SPI support is disabled

SPI1STAT.name: SPIRBF
SPI1STAT.caption: SPI Receive Buffer Full Status bit

values.caption: Receive buffer
Receive buffer

SPI1STAT.name: SPITBF
SPI1STAT.caption: SPI Transmit Buffer Full Status bit

values.caption: Transmit not yet started
Transmit buffer is not full

SPI1STAT.name: SPITBE
SPI1STAT.caption: SPI Transmit Buffer Empty Status bit

values.caption: Transmit buffer
Transmit buffer

SPI1STAT.name: SPIRBE
SPI1STAT.caption: RX FIFO Empty bit (valid only when ENHBUF = 1)

values.caption: RX FIFO is empty (CRPTR = SWPTR)
RX FIFO is not empty (CRPTR ? SWPTR)
A new data is completely received and discarded. The user software has not read the previous data in the SPIxBUF register.
No overflow has occurred
When SPI module shift register is empty
When SPI module shift register is not empty
Transmit buffer has encountered an underrun condition
Transmit buffer has no underrun condition
SPI peripheral is currently busy with some transactions
SPI peripheral is currently idle
Frame error detected
No Frame error detected

PCM/DSP mode
Right Justified mode
Left Justified mode
I2S mode
Audio data is mono (Each data word is transmitted on both left and right channels)
Audio data is stereo
Audio protocol enabled
Audio protocol disabled
A TUR is not a critical error and zeros are transmitted until the SPIxTXB is not empty
A TUR is a critical error which stop SPI operation
A ROV is not a critical error; during ROV data in the fifo is not overwritten by receive data
A ROV is a critical error which stop SPI operation

SPI1CON2.name: SPITUREN
SPI1CON2.caption: Enable Interrupt Events via SPITUR bit

values.caption: Transmit Underrun Generates Error Events
Transmit Underrun Does Not Generates Error Events

SPI1CON2.name: SPIROVEN
SPI1CON2.caption: Enable Interrupt Events via SPIROV bit

values.caption: Receive overflow generates error events
Receive overflow does not generate error events

SPI1CON2.name: FRMERREN
SPI1CON2.caption: Enable Interrupt Events via FRMERR bit

values.caption: Frame Error overflow generates error events
Frame Error does not generate error events

SPI1CON2.name: SPISGNEXT
SPI1CON2.caption: Sign Extend Read Data from the RX FIFO bit

values.caption: Data from RX FIFO is sign extended
Data from RX FIFO is not sign extened
